intro: Actinophyllum digitatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed actinophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Actinophyllum digitatum is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
